page.title: 08A GARAGE & A FAMILY BUTCHER
page.content: Crofts Garage has been there for 63 years.They sell diesel,petrol,spare parts, paraffin, sweets, crisps and drinks.The garage is not selfservice. They order the petrol and diesel once every 3 weeks;they get about 3500gals. of petrol and diesel.They MOT about 12 cars a day and a motorbike or two.They store their food and parts upstairs. The owner lives next to the garage. Stuckey's is a small family butchers. They buy live meat at Highbridge Mark- et,have it killed at the abattoir and cut it up themselves.Once cut,the meat is hung up in the storeroom.The meat is sold in the shop, but Mr. Stuckey delivers to some customers.He also sells local fruit and vegetables and tinned food. The boys who went touched the teeth of a dead pig and were given the eyes of a cow as souvenirs.
